p: Poly(ethylene glycol) rosin esters are oligomers, which can be prepared from rosin, polyethylene glycol and maleic anhydride, according to Scheme 53 prior to drying at 40–70 °C [ 81, 238]. Proposed applications include shells for controlled drug delivery [ 238, 239] and dental films for periodontitis treatment [ 240]. Moreover, maleopimaric acid PEG esters can show carbon steel corrosion protection properties [ 241].
